tool.name: Upload genomes

param.name: label
param.label: Genome label
param.help: Provide a unique genome label to identify this genome in further output files.

param.name: fastafile
param.label: Genome coding regions
param.help: Nucleotide fasta file containing coding regions in individual records from an outside source.

tool.help:
This tool allows you to upload genomes from external resources for analysis in the Genome-wide signatures of adaptive divergence pipeline. This could include unpublished genomes, or genomes not available from the NCBI RefSeq / GenBank.
- A unique label should be provided for each uploaded genome consisting of letters, digits and underscores. - Genomes should be uploaded as nucleotide fasta files containing protein coding regions in separate records. - Fasta headers will be altered, but identifiers will be preserved in altered form. - In-reading-frame gap codons ('---') will be removed. - Sequences should not result in ambiguous translations, and should therefore not contain ambiguous characters. - At present the translation table is fixed at the NCBI standard bacterial and plant plastid translation table 11.
